title: Honduras Votes for a New President with Surprise from U.S.
summary: People in Honduras voted on Sunday to choose a new president. The election was very close, with three main candidates having a chance to win. They are Moncada, who wants to help the economy for everyone; Nasralla, who says he will stop corruption; and Asfura, who supports businesses. A big surprise happened when U.S. President Donald Trump said he liked Asfura and would pardon a former Honduran president in prison. This made the election more interesting. Hondurans also voted for Congress and local leaders. They care about safety and jobs, even though the country is safer now than before. The voting day had music and flags outside schools where people lined up to vote.

when people in power do bad things for money
to forgive someone for a crime so they go free
when someone says they support a candidate
people who want to be elected

questions.question: What country held an election for president?
Who surprised Hondurans by endorsing a candidate?
How many main candidates had a chance to win?
What did Trump say he would do for a former president?
Where did people vote in the capital?

background_read: Honduras is a country in Central America. It has had problems with crime and poverty. Elections happen every few years to pick leaders. The U.S. is a big neighbor that sometimes gets involved in other countries' politics. A pardon means a leader can forgive someone for a crime, which is rare and can be controversial.
Article_Structure: WHO: Honduran voters and candidates like Moncada, Nasralla, and Asfura.
WHAT: An election for president, Congress, and local positions, with a surprise from U.S. President Trump.
WHERE: In Honduras, especially in the capital Tegucigalpa.
WHY: To choose new leaders and address issues like security and jobs, but Trump's actions made it more complicated.

perspectives.description: They want a leader who can improve safety and create jobs.
Trump's endorsement and pardon show the U.S. is interested in Honduras' politics.
